p.s: William Shakespeare is a famous englishEnglish poet and writer with big influence on englishEnglish culture and language.
But is he still relevant for young people today?
I want to discuss the pros and cons of the relevance of Shakespeare today.
On the one hand there are many arguments for the relevance of Shakespeare.
Shakespeare had and still has a big influence on the englishEnglish culture and language.
He made many idioms or figures of speech for example all that glitters is not gold and introduced roundabout 1700 new words into englishEnglish language.
Furthermore he is a big inspiration to young writers and poets because of his own career and influence.
Moreover his topics are still relevant today for example the problematic love of Romeo and Juliet which is still used today in many movies or something else.
His used characters and problems make it more understandable and interesting for the younger generation.
On the other hand there are also some contra arguments.
Especially in school Shakespeare seems very boring to young people because they do not know enough about him and his work.
This is caused by the hard language he uses.
Because of this it is difficult to understand him and to get into the topic of his work.
Despite Shakespeare seems to be very old-fashioned because his plays and sonnets are written in 1600 (17th century?).
Many young people think he is not modern enough.
In addition to that today are many new and young writer who are may be more interesting than Shakespeare because they are also young etc.
In conclusion there are many pros and cons of Shakespeare's relevance today because he had such a big influence but is also difficult to understand.
In my opinion Shakespeare is relevant to young people.
So who he is and what he has done but I can understand when young people think he is boring and not understandable.
I think that Shakespeare should be known but not as duty for example in school.
So everybody who is interested in him should be allowed to know more and who is not should not be forced to know him.
